questions.text_no: Hvem sa 'Jeg tenker, altså er jeg'? (1)
questions.text_en: Who said 'I think, therefore I am'? (1)
answers_no: Aristoteles
Sokrates
René Descartes
Immanuel Kant
answers_en: Aristotle
Socrates
René Descartes
Immanuel Kant
questions.explanation_no: René Descartes brukte utsagnet som et grunnleggende prinsipp i sin filosofi om rasjonalitet og eksistens.
questions.explanation_en: René Descartes used this statement as a foundational principle in his philosophy of rationality and existence.
questions.learnMore_no: Utsagnet stammer fra hans verk 'Meditasjoner over den første filosofi'.
questions.learnMore_en: The phrase comes from his work 'Meditations on First Philosophy'.

questions.text_no: Hva er Kants 'kategoriske imperativ'? (2)
questions.text_en: What is Kant's 'categorical imperative'? (2)
answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.
questions.learnMore_no: Et av de mest sentrale begrepene i moderne moralfilosofi.
questions.learnMore_en: One of the most central concepts in modern moral philosophy.

answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.
questions.learnMore_no: Et av de mest sentrale begrepene i moderne moralfilosofi.
questions.learnMore_en: One of the most central concepts in modern moral philosophy.

questions.text_no: Hva er Kants 'kategoriske imperativ'? (128)
questions.text_en: What is Kant's 'categorical imperative'? (128)
answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.

questions.text_no: Hva er Kants 'kategoriske imperativ'? (254)
questions.text_en: What is Kant's 'categorical imperative'? (254)
answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.

questions.text_no: Hva er Kants 'kategoriske imperativ'? (380)
questions.text_en: What is Kant's 'categorical imperative'? (380)
answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.

questions.text_no: Hva er Kants 'kategoriske imperativ'? (506)
questions.text_en: What is Kant's 'categorical imperative'? (506)
answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.

answers_no: Aristoteles
Sokrates
René Descartes
Immanuel Kant
answers_en: Aristotle
Socrates
René Descartes
Immanuel Kant
questions.explanation_no: René Descartes brukte utsagnet som et grunnleggende prinsipp i sin filosofi om rasjonalitet og eksistens.
questions.explanation_en: René Descartes used this statement as a foundational principle in his philosophy of rationality and existence.
questions.learnMore_no: Utsagnet stammer fra hans verk 'Meditasjoner over den første filosofi'.
questions.learnMore_en: The phrase comes from his work 'Meditations on First Philosophy'.

questions.text_no: Hva er Kants 'kategoriske imperativ'? (726)
questions.text_en: What is Kant's 'categorical imperative'? (726)
answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.
questions.learnMore_no: Et av de mest sentrale begrepene i moderne moralfilosofi.
questions.learnMore_en: One of the most central concepts in modern moral philosophy.

answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.
questions.learnMore_no: Et av de mest sentrale begrepene i moderne moralfilosofi.
questions.learnMore_en: One of the most central concepts in modern moral philosophy.

questions.text_no: Hva er Kants 'kategoriske imperativ'? (914)
questions.text_en: What is Kant's 'categorical imperative'? (914)
answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.
questions.learnMore_no: Et av de mest sentrale begrepene i moderne moralfilosofi.
questions.learnMore_en: One of the most central concepts in modern moral philosophy.

answers_no: At handlinger må vurderes ut fra konsekvensene
At mennesket er et mål i seg selv
At man skal handle slik at ens handling kan gjøres til en universell lov
At følelser er viktigere enn fornuft
answers_en: That actions must be judged by their consequences
That humans are ends in themselves
That one should act only according to that maxim which can be willed as a universal law
That emotions are more important than reason
questions.explanation_no: Det kategoriske imperativ er Kants prinsipp om at man skal handle etter regler som kan gjelde for alle.
questions.explanation_en: The categorical imperative is Kant's principle that one should act according to rules that could apply universally.
questions.learnMore_no: Et av de mest sentrale begrepene i moderne moralfilosofi.
questions.learnMore_en: One of the most central concepts in modern moral philosophy.

questions.text_no: Hvem sa 'Jeg tenker, altså er jeg'? (977)

answers_no: Aristoteles
Sokrates
René Descartes
Immanuel Kant
answers_en: Aristotle

questions.explanation_no: René Descartes brukte utsagnet som et grunnleggende prinsipp i sin filosofi om rasjonalitet og eksistens.
questions.explanation_en: René Descartes used this statement as a foundational principle in his philosophy of rationality and existence.
questions.learnMore_no: Utsagnet stammer fra hans verk 'Meditasjoner over den første filosofi'.
questions.learnMore_en: The phrase comes from his work 'Meditations on First Philosophy'.
